image.altText: Baby twins, Max (left) and Blake (right) sit on their parents's laps wearing matching Bluey jumpers

props.synopsis: Researchers in Adelaide are looking to expand newborn heel-prick screening to help identify up to 600 additional genetic conditions early.

title.children: Up to 1,000 families to take part in newborn heel-prick screening research

image.altText: A close up shot of a man's hand holding a rain gauge showing almost 24mm of rain

props.synopsis: Much-needed rain has soaked parched land across parts of South Australia but farmers say more is required to break the drought.

title.children: Rain a 'celebration' but not a drought-breaker for SA farmers

image.altText: A black and brown puppy held by a boy

props.synopsis: Downpours during the Australian Kelpie Muster bring smiles, not scowls, to a drought-stricken town in western Victoria.

title.children: Tails wag at kelpie muster as rain drenches town ravaged by drought

image.altText: Three children on a large dinosaur statue.

props.synopsis: An unexpected online auction win lands an eight-metre-long, three-metre-tall dinosaur in a Milang front yard — and brings smiles and new visitors to the struggling town.

title.children: How an impulse purchase gone wrong became this town's unofficial mascot

image.altText: A frowning woman with curly blonde hair and wearing a blue shirt sits in front of an open laptop.

props.synopsis: A clinical psychologist warns that winter rain will not "wash away the worries" caused by severe drought across southern Australia.

title.children: More farmers seek mental health support as drought a 'daily rollercoaster'

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan swimming over a lane rope in the pool, smiling, after winning a final

props.synopsis: Some of Australia's future swimming stars will battle this week to earn selection for this year's World Aquatics Championships.

title.children: Eyes on Adelaide as national swimming trials give first glimpse at future

image.altText: Baz Luhrmann wearing a dark green and silver suit and Catherine Martin in a dark green long sleeve dress with silver flowers

props.synopsis: Some 830 Australians will be recognised as part of the King's Birthday 2025 honours on Monday, including film director Baz Luhrmann and his frequent collaborator Catherine Martin, an award-winning costume, production and set designer.

title.children: King's Birthday honours list includes Hollywood heavyweights, local heroes

image.altText: A police supplied image of three young children

props.synopsis: South Australian police are calling for information about three children under the age of three who were last seen more than two weeks ago. They are believed to be with a woman known to them.

title.children: SA Police has welfare concerns for three children missing for weeks

image.altText: People demonstrate during a protest against federal immigration sweeps in downtown Los Angeles

props.synopsis: Protesters blocked off a major freeway and set self-driving cars on fire as law enforcement used tear gas, rubber bullets and flash bangs to control the crowd.

title.children: Protests escalate as California governor says Trump is acting like a dictator, not a president

image.altText: Drone shot of water and port surrounding a steelwork factory

props.synopsis: GFG Alliance has placed its subsidiary company which formerly operated the Whyalla port into administration, saying it was left with no other option after the state government intervened in an ownership dispute over the facility.

title.children: GFG puts Whyalla port company into administration after 'severe impact' on revenue

image.altText: lady sitting on orange couch smiling at camera

props.synopsis: When Geranium Primary School was forced to close its doors due to dwindling enrolment numbers, it shut a century-old chapter for the tiny town. But then one former teacher with big dreams stepped in to help her town blossom again.

title.children: Town of 80 buys old primary school for $1.10 and turns it into op shop

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown resting on lane ropes in the pool after a swimming race at the Olympic Games, looking at the timing board

props.synopsis: Defending 50m backstroke world champion Kaylee McKeown appeared to have her hopes of defending the crown dashed, after being disqualified from her heat on the opening day of the Australian Swimming Trials.

title.children: Aussie Kaylee McKeown disqualified, but wins protest at world champ trials

image.altText: Max Gawn pushes teammate Steven May after a conversation

props.synopsis: Max Gawn is not impressed with some instant feedback from teammate Steven May after a costly late turnover in Melbourne's one-point loss to Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: Melbourne stars in fiery clash after losing thriller to Collingwood

image.altText: A large white coral-like boulder tube and a scuba diver in deep blue water.

props.synopsis: Damage to sensitive sea floor ecosystems sparks calls for tighter regulation of the tourist ship industry in the Antarctic region.

title.children: World-first footage shows Antarctic sea floor scoured by cruise ship anchors

image.altText: Two men wrestle on inside a UFC octagon. Seen through the wire of its fence, one man straddles the other.

props.synopsis: Beneath the profitable success story of the UFC lies a hidden reality: many athletes who have dedicated their careers to the sport are struggling and are unable to fight back.

title.children: Tyson was 'willing to die' for the UFC. He changed his mind after getting paid

image.altText: a man being arrested by police at his home

props.synopsis: Police will allege four people were involved in an elaborate money laundering scheme that smuggled cash around the country.

title.children: Four charged with money laundering as $21 million in assets seized

image.altText: A collection of candles and light up plastic butterflies on a garden edge

props.synopsis: Bright colours and butterflies are used to remember the life of 17-year-old Pheobe Bishop who was allegedly murdered by her housemates three weeks ago.

title.children: Bundaberg twilight vigil remembers 17-year-old Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The new proclamation, which Trump signed last week, applies to citizens from 12 mainly African and Middle Eastern countries.

title.children: Trump's new travel ban on citizens from 12 nations takes effect

image.altText: Chief Photographer

props.synopsis: A new study finds that EV myths are so ingrained in society that even owners believe misinformation that they catch fire more easily and emit electromagnetic fields that damage health.

title.children: Are EVs more likely to catch fire? Why we're still falling for the myths

image.altText: The former PM seated and grinning

props.synopsis: The 30th prime minister has been appointed a Companion of the Order of Australia for his "eminent service" to the country and direction during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: Scott Morrison receives Australia's highest honour for COVID leadership

image.altText: Sarah Snook standing on stage with an award and a microphone in front of her, wearing a tight fitting glittery dress

props.synopsis: Australian actor Sarah Snook has won the Tony award for Best Leading Actress in a Play for The Picture of Dorian Gray, with fellow Australian Marg Horwell also taking home a Tony for Costume Design.

title.children: Sarah Snook wins Tony award for lead performance in The Picture of Dorian Gray

image.altText: A hazy view of mountains over suburbia.

props.synopsis: The state government claims there are some recipients earning well above the income limit that determines who is eligible for social housing.

title.children: Queensland to review social housing after finding couple making $200k

image.altText: The original church bell, made of bronze, hanging from a roof.

props.synopsis: A Hunter Valley farming community is reeling after a church bell that rang out the day World War I ended was stolen.

title.children: Thieves use angle grinder to shear off 185-year-old church bell

image.altText: Bridget Archer

props.synopsis: Former federal Liberal MP Bridget Archer once said a Hobart AFL stadium was "unnecessary". Now she says she supports the project, just days after seeking Liberal preselection for a possible state election.

title.children: Bridget Archer changes tack to back Hobart stadium '100 per cent'

image.altText: The outside of the Toowoomba Court

props.synopsis: A man who had been accessing child exploitation material since before the birth of the internet had a spreadsheet on his fridge detailing children's events, a court has heard.

title.children: 'Hermit' with sexual interest in children had eisteddfod times on fridge

image.altText: Generic disposable coffee cup held in a hand with beach in background.

props.synopsis: US tariffs and supply issues are creating uncertainty for an already strained coffee market, and roasters say it's only a matter of time before Australians will pay more for their brew.

title.children: Coffee prices up to $12 needed to make industry viable, supplier says

image.altText: A drone shot of a plot of land

props.synopsis: New peer-reviewed research has found artificial intelligence could help boost productivity in urban planning but some experts warn government regulation is needed in the adoption of AI.

title.children: Artificial intelligence could help plan cities, but there are downsides

image.altText: A side profile view of Roger Cook who is smiling while wearing a suit

props.synopsis: Western Australians could see a realignment of public holidays to coincide with the east coast and have an additional public holiday added to the calendar as soon as next year, WA Premier Roger Cook says.

title.children: Roger Cook flags shake-up of WA public holiday calendar

image.altText: An aerial view of the township of Wadeye (Port Keats).

props.synopsis: A man who died in police custody at a Darwin hospital on Saturday has been remembered as a "great visionary and educator" as the remote community of Wadeye mourns his loss.

title.children: Senior Wadeye elder identified as latest NT death in custody

image.altText: The Northern Beaches Hospital

props.synopsis: Doctors at the troubled Northern Beaches Hospital say they warned management about understaffing and inadequate equipment before the facility even opened.

title.children: Doctors deliberately hiding equipment: Inside a worsening hospital crisis

image.altText: A man holding a beer pushing a homemade boat into the ocean.

props.synopsis: The Down Under Safari Pirates have won the 51st Darwin Beer Can Regatta at Mindil Beach with a boat made from plastic drums and empty beer cans.

title.children: Boats made of beer cans put to the test at Darwin charity race

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair smiles, she has a nose ring.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Attorney-General says Courtney Anderson's family provided new information and shared their concerns that the case was not fully investigated.

title.children: Inquest for woman who died after fall from moving car on Bruce Highway

image.altText: Photo of All Are Welcome bakery window with a building reflected in the glass.

props.synopsis: Melbourne bakery workers are likely to be thousands of dollars out-of-pocket in unpaid super entitlements. Could a new law have protected them?

title.children: 'Payday super' means you'll get your super when you get your wages

image.altText: Girl and boy holding boogie board and hockey sticks in vineyard covered by snow

props.synopsis: People across swathes of inland NSW have woken to a dusting of snow, marking the first fall of the season for some regions.

title.children: City of Orange turns white as snow blankets inland NSW

image.altText: A large air duct fallen to the ground in an industrial building.

props.synopsis: Yallourn Power Station, considered the region's most unreliable, has been forced to put one of its units offline for weeks after an air duct collapsed.

title.children: Worksafe investigating air duct collapse at Gippsland power station
